comment: He teaches, gets up there, talks for 75min straight, gives "potential test questions" and none were on tests... questions were not from lectures or book. Some also had several correct answers. Memorized all my notes, read the book, and all for a C. I learned nothing, and guessed my way through. Good luck with him.

I enjoyed coming to class (lectures were about European revolutions).  Some of the questions on the tests were ambiguous, but I managed to get around an 87 on the tests and quizzes and got an A in the class because I did the extra credit that he offered.  He assigns readings which really help to supplement his lectures.  I enjoyed the class.
i had always been great at history until his class. He is a nice guy i would not recommend taking him. exams are very opinionated power point notes that aren't  helpful and never used the book.

His tests and quizes are very opinionated. There are always questions with two possible answer and you have to guess what he thinks is right. If you dont mind studying your ass off, only to get a B then take the class. Otherwise, find another professor

He isn't horrible, just not the greatest. If you participate in class and act interested then he is nice to you. He gives a whole lot of notes and his tests are kind of difficult. He words them in weird ways and asks really specific questions. It would be best to do all his extra credit stuff. It is hard to get an A, but a B or C is easily doable.

WORST HISTORY TEACHER I HAVE EVER MET IN MY LIFE!!!!! He gives two test and two quizzes for the semeter if u fail two your done. Gives power power points to use for notes but there a useless unless you which ones to study for. His test and quizzes were extremely hard...DONT TAKE HIS  CLASS UNLESS U PLAN TO FAIL!!!

There are a lot of negatives about him on here, but I don't see why. If you are respectful to him in the beginning of the year and show interest in the class, he will help you all the way. Plenty of extra credit, plenty of notes. Tests are a little hard if you don't understand the concepts. And he is pretty funny! Give the guy a break

Avoid this teacher at all costs! He is confusing, dry and boring. He focuses almost to almost a microscopic level on some topics but flies by other. He is combative and unhelpful, and his tests are hell. This is the first time in my life I have ever failed ANY history class I think he is very much the reason why.
Fun class. Listen well and read the book. You'll pass all the tests easily. Extra credit assignments help too!

I ALWAYS fell asleep in history, then I switched to him. I studied about one hour before each test/quiz and got an high C or something. He cant make you chuckle sometimes witch is nice. You really dont need the textbook

Very straight forward with lectures. Gave us plentiful chances for extra credit. Told us everything we needed to know and tailored the test to match the lecture. Other than his monotone voice, this professor is a prime example of what a professor should be.
He is very straight-forward.  He comes in, lectures for an hour and a half, and that's that.  Take good notes and study for the tests and you'll do fine.  Nice guy.

Worst History teacher. Didn't follow the book. No PowerPoints online. Talked about nonsense in class. Spent a couple months on the Renaissance in a U.S. History course. His tests barely matched up the the material covered in lecture. Skutans is not organized and has no sense of direction for the class, His vocabulary consists of 1 word: per say.
Interesting professor, his lectures are great but test are really hard. Do his EC and you will be fine.

Took him for World Civ. Interesting guy and lectures from power points and from his own material. Do all extra credit opportunities and you will be fine. Learn what his opinion is and you will do fine. Read the book and understand the material and you will do fine in his class.
If you love listening to a monologue for a hour and a half this is your guy. He talks you take notes, you test. That's it no interaction. Just flat out boring

DONT TAKE THIS GUY! He is a very bad teacher. He teaches based on opinion, he doesn't respect his students, and he doesnt care! He never posts any of the grades online and he actually lost my extra credit that I spent 4 hours on! DO NOT TAKE!!!!

The exams are extremely difficult with questions that have arguable answers, and some questions were inconsistent with lectures. These exams are the only part of the course grade, as well. Even with copious notes (I've got about 12 sets of notes that are about 600-1000 words each) and studying, my grades were quite low. Do not recommend.

Worst proffesor I've ever had. Dry sense of humor but can be rude. Treats students like high schoolers. Extremely biased and doesn't care about overall success of the student. NEVER take him!! Unless you want to waste your time studying for hours on a test you won't be able to make a good grade on...

Skutans is interesting. his tests are near impossible to get an A, but he gives ample extra credit. the extra credit will bring your overall grade up a letter grade if you do it right. he uses a different book from the one assigned, and teaches directly out of it. 2 tests 2 quizzes and that's it for grading. would not recommend. per se...

Prof seems like a nice guy but he's a terrible teacher. His tests are based on opinion and are inconsistent with what he teaches in class. He gives extra credit but it doesn't count for very much. He is horrible!!! If there is another teacher you can take my  advice is to take that person. RUN from this class don't walk.
Horrible. Very unclear, doesn't need to be a teacher. Test and quizzes are extremely hard and very opinionated. I will be lucky to pull out of this class with a C with extra credit.

Extremely difficult tests, take a LOT of notes during lectures and read the textbook often. He is not an easy teacher but the class is definitely passable. I liked this teacher, he is funny although he overuses the word per-say incorrectly but That is likely because English is a second language for him so per-say is the equivalent of me saying um..

Worst professor I have ever had. Repeats "per se" after EVERYTHING he says, to the point where it becomes absolutely obnoxious. Tests covered almost NOTHING from the lectures, and had extremely opinion-based questions. Do NOT take this professor! I honestly don't understand how he still has his job at this university.
This was the hardest class I have ever in my life because of this professor.His tests are terrible and grading system is really bad.So my advice is not to take any class with him.
"Per se". Hard to understand and isn't real clear on the subject matter. Tardiness and attendance are big for him, even though it doesn't help you understand what he's saying. "Per se".

He is very hard to understand, and can't generally hear you. His final covered things we hadn't gone over. I would've had an A if he hadn't voided my extra credit for a stupid reason-- Take Soiset ya'll.

I absolutely love history but had an extremely hard time with his exams.  Basically, they were very ambiguous multiple choice exams that may or may not have anything to do with the lectures from class. And yes, I take copious notes.  Only got a B in class even though I knew information.  Things never translated well on his exams....

worst history teacher i have ever had. does not give tests other than scantron. does not get to know the students names. test are hard and not on subject matter ex. what writers wrote in gothic style. my recommendation, do not take this teacher!

Extremely friendly--he "likes to see you smile"--but not intrusive. He teaches the basics, what most well-rounded people should know about history during this period. Intelligent too! His mult. choice tests are a bit difficult, but he gave us a choice between essays and mult. choice for our first test. Lets us out a few minutes early sometimes.
He never use PPT, and I cannot find any handwriting on the blackboard. I depend on my poor listening and simple notes
pretty easy as long as you come to class and pay attention. He's easy to understand, and goes everything thoroughly. He usually has a review day before each quiz or test and goes over every question.

Almost the worst teacher I have ever had in my life.  The guy can't even clarify what he said just minutes prior (he won't know what you're talking about).  There were only 3 tests, each 33% of the semester grade.  Test contents were mostly based on one day's lecture, not all.  Very disorganized, rude, and hard to follow.

Dose not make any attempt to know any of the students except his advisees.  He forbids the use of laptops so if  you ahve any organizational problms or disgraphia your out of luck.  For his first quiz I studied for 8 hours and recieved a C on it.  Also in general you know who the usual A students are and all of them made C's as well.

Repeats useless info a lot, but if you ask him to repeat something he can't remember what he said. Teaches from a humanistic worldview. Does not know what he is talking about most of the time. I could've learned more history if I just read any history book. In fact, I learned more in high school courses. AVOID if you want an easy A or knowledge.

Does NOT know a lot about history. Contradicts himself. Quizzes are vague and for most MC questions either all of the answers could be right or none of them. Does not consider other opinions credible. Only two tests, each 33% of your grade. Subtracts points for tardiness.
Good Teacher. Attend classes.TAKE NOTES. QUESTIONS ONLY FROM NOTES. Study his notes. easy A.
He is terrible, most of the multiple choice answers on his tests and quizzes are arguably correct
Unfair...misinforms stidets does not know what he is talking about

PROS: Extremely knowledgeable; Possibly the best lecturer I have ever taken; Unbiased (a rare quality for a history prof); Does not take attendance; Takes a worldly approach to teaching US History; Gives ample warning regarding ?pop-quizzes? CONS: Tough, but fair, grader; ?Pop-quizzes;? Doesn?t teach enough classes

He is a great teacher he trys to make the class fun. He is a very hard grader. he gives 2 surprise quizes a midterm and final. The quizes are easy if you study. When it comes to the Midterm and final he gives u about 40 essays question before hand and saids i will pick 3 for your midterm.MAKE SURE U COME TO CLASS BECAUSE U HAVE TWO SURPRISE QUIZZES
